method.name: B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Methodâ„¢
method.fullTitle: The B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Methodâ„¢ for Hormone Health
method.description: A comprehensive 7-step framework for identifying, understanding, and correcting hormonal imbalances through nutrition, lifestyle, and functional approaches. Designed specifically for women's unique hormonal landscape across all life stages.

steps.title: Baseline Assessment
steps.description: Map the client's complete hormonal picture: cycle patterns, symptoms, stress levels, sleep quality, and metabolic markers.

steps.title: Align with the Cycle
steps.description: Teach cycle syncing â€” aligning nutrition, exercise, and activities with the four phases of the menstrual cycle for optimal hormonal support.

steps.title: Leverage Nutrition
steps.description: Implement hormone-supportive nutrition: seed cycling, cruciferous vegetables, healthy fats, and targeted micronutrients for each hormonal phase.

steps.title: Address Stress Pathways
steps.description: Manage cortisol and the HPA axis through evidence-based stress reduction: adaptogenic herbs, breathwork, and nervous system regulation.

steps.title: Nurture Detox Pathways
steps.description: Support the liver, gut, and lymphatic system in metabolizing and clearing excess hormones naturally.

steps.title: Calibrate Movement
steps.description: Design exercise protocols that support hormonal health â€” not sabotage it. Address over-exercise, under-recovery, and hormonal impacts of different workout types.

steps.title: Evaluate & Evolve
steps.description: Track symptoms, labs, and quality-of-life markers to measure progress and adjust the protocol as hormones respond.

examQuestions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the 'Big 5' hormones discussed in hormone health coaching?
examQuestions.explanation: The 'Big 5' hormones in women's hormone health are Estrogen, Progesterone, Testosterone, Cortisol, and Thyroid. Insulin is important but is typically addressed in metabolic health coaching.

examQuestions.question: What does 'cycle syncing' mean in the B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Methodâ„¢?
options: Aligning nutrition, exercise, and activities with the four phases of the menstrual cycle
Riding a bicycle for hormone health
examQuestions.explanation: Cycle syncing aligns nutrition, exercise, and daily activities with the menstrual, follicular, ovulatory, and luteal phases to support optimal hormonal function.

examQuestions.question: What are endocrine disruptors?
options: Environmental toxins that interfere with the body's hormone system
examQuestions.explanation: Endocrine disruptors are chemicals found in plastics, pesticides, and personal care products that mimic or block natural hormones, contributing to hormonal imbalances.

examQuestions.question: Why might excessive high-intensity exercise be harmful for some women's hormonal health?
options: It can spike cortisol and disrupt the HPA axis, worsening hormonal imbalances
examQuestions.explanation: Excessive high-intensity exercise can chronically elevate cortisol, disrupting the HPA axis and potentially worsening hormonal imbalances, especially in women already under stress.

examQuestions.question: What is the purpose of 'seed cycling' in hormone health?
options: Rotating specific seeds (flax, pumpkin, sesame, sunflower) during different cycle phases to support hormone production
examQuestions.explanation: Seed cycling involves consuming specific seeds during different phases of the menstrual cycle â€” flax and pumpkin seeds in the follicular phase, sesame and sunflower in the luteal phase â€” to naturally support estrogen and progesterone balance.

zombie.name: Angela
zombie.backstory: Corporate executive who hit perimenopause at 42 and was told by her doctor to 'just deal with it.' Hot flashes, brain fog, weight gain, mood swings â€” she felt like she was losing herself.
zombie.transformation: After discovering the B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Methodâ„¢, Angela reversed her perimenopausal symptoms through cycle syncing and nutrition. She got certified and now coaches other women in the same transition.
zombie.incomeStory: Angela earns $6,100/month running 90-day hormone health programs for women over 40. She left corporate 6 months ago and says it was the best decision of her life.
zombie.writingStyle: Confident, science-leaning, uses fire emojis. Not afraid to rant about conventional medicine dismissing women. Loves sharing lab results and progress photos.

faq.q: Do I need a medical background?
faq.a: No. Hormone health coaching focuses on nutrition, lifestyle, and functional approaches â€” not medical treatment or prescribing.

faq.q: Is this just for menopausal women?
faq.a: Not at all. Hormonal imbalances affect women at every life stage â€” from teens with PCOS to postpartum moms to women in their 60s.
Absolutely. The B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Methodâ„¢ is built on peer-reviewed research in endocrinology, functional medicine, and nutritional science.
